results.title: Island target
results.creator_credit: Ralph Smart and Jack S. Allan
results.brief_description: The story of one squadron of Australian airmen in action against the Japanese in the islands north of Australia. The work of the squadron included the covering of Allied landings and a hazardous attack on Japanese headquarteres on one particular island.
results.description: The story of one squadron of Australian airmen in action against the Japanese in the islands north of Australia. The work of the squadron included the covering of Allied landings and a hazardous attack on Japanese headquarteres on one particular island.

results.title: Is anybody doing anything about it?
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Richard Mason and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A dramatised introduction to the work of the Bureau of Meteorology, showing how weather information is collected and used for reports and predictions, with impressions of the importance of the weather in various industries. Shows how at the Southern Hemisphere Analysis Centre in Melbourne, synoptic charts are drawn up by computers. A global weather pattern can be seen every six hours. Cast features Carmen Duncan and Tom Oliver.

results.title: An Introduction to motor cycling
results.creator_credit: Peter Johnson, Tony Hansen, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Inexperience, unpreparedness, and a powerful machine, are al1 factors which cause motor cycle accidents, and contribute to an awful and unnecessary waste. Points out the different types of motor cycles appropriate to different individuals, purposes and situations, as well as explaining how a motor cycle works.

results.title: Inspecting the car
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “How to Drive”.
Good driving depends on good habits and a quick daily inspection as well as regular maintenance of those items which directly affect safety is the first good habit to develop. Demonstrates a quick and easy method of checking items, by starting at the driver’s door and walking anti-clockwise around the car.

results.title: In harbour
results.creator_credit: Joan Boundy, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows the work of the many people who are engaged in working on Sydney Harbour - the fishermen who gain their livelihood from its waters, those who maintain its laws and ensure its cleanliness, those who maintain its equipment and preserve its many miles of wharves and those who dredge its bed and attend to its buoys. They keep the harbour for the ships from many lands to use, but themselves never go “outside”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Joan Boundy, Eric Thompson and Australian National Film Board

They keep the harbour for the ships from many lands to use, but themselves never go “outside”.

results.title: In a manner of speaking
results.creator_credit: Colin Dean and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Illustrates how the telephone can be used to conduct efficient business, and how good habits will improve relations with clients on the telephone. Advice is given on aids to switch-board staff to generally facilitate service to clients. Camera and lighting by Frank Bagnall and George Lowe.

results.title: Hospitals don't burn down
results.creator_credit: Brian Trenchard-Smith, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A disturbingly realistic film about a fire in a high-rise hospital. It dramatically portrays the horror and awful consequences of such a tragedy. Demonstrates the results of good and bad training and the need for all personnel to learn basic drills and routines in case of fire. Cast includes Jeanne Drynan, Mark Edwards, Ray Marshall, Ralph Cotterill, Ken Goodlet.
